title: GPT-4o emission per token (Ruf & Mortas)
description:
Official information about the architecture of GPT-4o is not available. In this scenario, we propose using our most optimistic energy consumption estimate made for GPT-4 and utilizing the price difference of both models as a proxy.

OpenAI charges different prices for input and output tokens. Due to the mechanism of key-value (KV) caching, output tokens need more memory and therefore consume more energy than input tokens. For this reason, use the price for output tokens as proxy.

Currently, 1 million output tokens of GPT-4-turbo cost $30, while they cost $10 for GPT-4o. Therefore, we assume a query to GPT-4o to require 3x less energy than for GPT-4.
